newsitem.title: ROMANIA: ROMANIA JULY INFLATION HITS RECORD 0.7 PCT LOW.
newsitem.headline: ROMANIA JULY INFLATION HITS RECORD 0.7 PCT LOW.

text.p: Romanian monthly inflation eased to a record low of 0.7 percent last month from June's 2.3 percent, lower than a previous forecast of between one to 1.5 percent, the National Statistics Board (CNS) said on Friday.
It said year-on-year inflation went down to 159.8 percent in July from 177.4 percent. Consumer prices rose by 102.6 percent from December 1996.
July's figure was the lowest since October 1990, when prices were first freed in Romania after the 1989 fall of communism.
Prime Minister Victor Ciorbea said on Thursday monthly inflation would probably stand at between one to two percent until end-1997, down from previous forecasts of two to three percent.

Officials also revised up the 1997 year-on-year inflation to about 130 percent from a previous estimate of 90 percent. The revision followed higher than expected prices rises in February and March when the centrist coalition government liberalised prices of fuel, energy and staples.
